title: The Faceless Ones

continuity_notes.name: The Chameleons
continuity_notes.description: A generation of aliens made faceless by an accidental nuclear explosion. They are a dying race claiming to be the most intelligent beings in the Universe.
continuity_notes.current_status: Seeking to assume the form of kidnapped humans to survive

continuity_notes.name: The Director
continuity_notes.current_status: Leading the Chameleons' efforts to survive

continuity_notes.name: Polly
continuity_notes.current_status: Involved in the adventure, with a double named Michelle Leuppi

continuity_notes.name: Jamie
continuity_notes.current_status: Involved in the adventure, his term 'ray gun' is used by the Doctor

technobabble: The Doctor uses Jamie's term 'ray gun' throughout.
roots: The Invasion of the Body Snatchers
I Married a Monster from Outer Space

locations.name: Gatwick airport
locations.description: Main setting for the Earth-based scenes

additional_notes: Joe Orton wrote in his diary on 15 April 1967: 'Watched Doctor Who on television. Rubbish… but there's a young boy in it who is worth looking at…' This is thought to be a reference to Christopher Tranchell or Frazer Hines.
bottom_line: 'You must have a double.' Doctor Who's second attempt to return its narrative to the 1960s. As with 'The War Machines', the realistic backdrop works very well, and the script is well-constructed, augmented by the terrifying appearance of the aliens.
